meanings.definition: A five-membered heterocyclic compound containing four carbon atoms and one nitrogen atom.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the structure of the pyrrol under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Pyrrol is commonly found in various organic compounds.
meanings.sent3: The pyrrol molecule walked into a chemistry class and everyone stared.
meanings.sent4: Her love for chemistry was like a pyrrol, always bonding with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The unique shape of the pyrrol made it easy to identify in the experiment.

meanings.sent1: The lab technician synthesized a new pyrrol for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: Many medications contain pyrrol derivatives for their beneficial effects.
meanings.sent3: The pyrrol derivative decided to change its name to 'Pyrrolina'.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was a pyrrol derivative, always branching out into new projects.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the pyrrol derivative caught everyone's attention in the lab.
